processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by UCLA Library Special Collections staff.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Des Marais by born on June 23, 1920, in Menominee, MI.; studied with Leo Sowerby in Chicago; BA (1949), MA (1953), Harvard Univ., where he studied with Nadia Boulanger and Walter Piston; taught composition at the University of California, Los Angeles from 1960; works include the operas Epiphanies (1964-8) and Le cimeti√®re marin (1971), two piano sonatas (1947, 1952), music for various vocal and instrumental ensembles, and incidental music for theatrical and dance productions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of manuscripts and ozalid masters of scores of compositions by Paul Des Marais.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
Collection is arranged chronologically.

Piano Sonata in G (1952). Ozalid masters, blank ink, 37 leaves.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "To Robert Moevs." Dated "Peterborough, New Hampshire, 1-31 July, 1952."

did.unittitle: Theme and changes : for harpsichord (1953). Ozalid masters, black ink, 16 leaves.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Written for and dedicated to Sylvia Marlowe"--title page. Dated "July, Peterborough, 1953."

did.unittitle: For the time being : Two choral excerpts. Ozalid masters, black ink, 21 leaves.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: I. At the Manger; II. Chorus (Finale). "1955, Boston.. With the permission of Mr. W. H. Auden."--title page. For chorus and three pianos.

did.unittitle: Motet in three movements : for mixed voices, cellos and double basses (1959). Ozalid masters, black ink, 33 leaves.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

did.unittitle: Capriccio : for two pianos, celesta, and percussion (three performers) (1962). Ozalid masters, pencil, 76 leaves.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Score (62 leaves) and percussion parts (14 leaves). "Los Angeles, 1962"--title page.

did.unittitle: Epiphanies : a theatre piece for 33 performers (1968). Ozalid masters, pencil and typescript, 147 leaves.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Los Angeles, June 1964-March 1969. Annotations and corrections XII.3.70"--title page. Contents: Film 1; Scene A; Film 2. Includes score and percussion parts for Scene A only.

did.unittitle: Epiphanies (part 2) (1968). Ozalid masters, pencil and typescript, 150 leaves.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contents: Film 3; Scene B; Film 4; Scene C. Score.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Organum 1-5, score, 47 leaves; Organum 1-4, score, 23 leaves; Organum 1-5; percussion part, 8 leaves. "Peterborough, 1972 (1 through 5), Los Angeles, 1980 (6)"--title page.

did.unittitle: The God of love love my Shepherd is.. Ozalid masters, pencil and typescript, 4 leaves.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
